text: Arapahoe Creek is a stream in Andrew and Nodaway counties of northwest Missouri.New Point, MO, 7.5 Minute Topographic Quadrangle, USGS, 1981 It is a tributary to the Nodaway River. The stream headwaters arise in southwest Nodaway County about 4.5 miles southwest of the community of Barnard and west of U.S. Route 71. The stream flows south into Andrew County and flows southwest to its confluence with the Nodaway River about 2.5 miles northwest of the community of Fillmore. Holt County lies on the west side of the Nodaway River at the confluence.Missouri Atlas & Gazetteer, DeLorme, 1998, First edition, p. 19, Arapahoe Creek was named after the Arapaho Native Americans. ==See also== *List of rivers of Missouri ==References== Category:Rivers of Andrew County, Missouri Category:Rivers of Nodaway County, Missouri Category:Rivers of Missouri
title: Arapahoe Creek
